meanings.definition: To divide, distribute, or assess proportionally.
meanings.sent1: We will prorate the expenses equally among all team members.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prorate the bonus based on each employee's hours worked.
meanings.sent3: Let's prorate the snacks for the party so everyone gets a fair share.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to prorate her attention between the students who needed help.
meanings.sent5: It's important to prorate the time spent on each task to ensure efficiency.

meanings.sent1: The utility company will prorate the bill according to the number of days in the billing cycle.
meanings.sent2: They had to prorate the rent for the month since the tenant moved in halfway through.
meanings.sent3: I had to prorate the ingredients for the recipe because I only wanted to make half.
meanings.sent4: The team decided to prorate the prize money based on each member's contribution.
meanings.sent5: She had to prorate her time between work and family responsibilities.

meanings.sent1: The charity organization will prorate the donations to different causes.
meanings.sent2: They will prorate the available resources among the various departments.
meanings.sent3: The coach had to prorate the playing time among all team members.
meanings.sent4: The committee decided to prorate the budget based on the needs of each project.
meanings.sent5: It's important to prorate the tasks evenly to avoid overloading any team member.
